column9: Benjamin Harrison was the sitting president when electricity was first installed in the White House. However

column9: Since Cleveland is the only president to ever serve two non-consecutive terms
column10: he warrants two slides. While he was president
column11: doctors discovered that Cleveland had a cancerous lesion in his mouth
column12: and they had to remove most of his upper-left jaw as a result. A prosthodontist then installed an artificial jaw made of vulcanized rubber. Cleveland kept the surgery a secret
column13: fearing public concerns over his health
column14: and the entire operation took place on his friend’s yacht.

column13: aside from the occasional asthma attack

column9: After leaving office

column11: effectively becoming the only person to serve as the head of two branches of government. In doing so
column12: he swore in both Calvin Coolidge and Herbert Hoover to the presidency. (On an unrelated note
column13: he also lost 150 pounds after leaving office.)
